Key Match Events: Mark Adair c & b Gordon 34 (24b 3x4 1x6 33m) SR: 141.66.
Pre-Game Insights: Harry Tector could be a doubtful starter after injuring his thumb against India.
The fast bowlers have so far held sway in New York, having picked up 18 of the 26 wickets to fall while going at an economy rate of 5.46.
Canada and Ireland have suffered losses in their opening games.
Canada, who played their opening fixture in Dallas where they went down to USA in a high-scoring clash, haven't been in great T20I form.
The Canada-Ireland fixture will likely take place on pitch no. 4, the same one that hosted the India-Ireland clash and the warm-up game between India and Bangladesh.
Dilon Heyliger's all-round abilities could be useful for Canada.
Mark Adair has been in excellent form this year.
Both teams might want to go pace-heavy on this surface.
There was visible bruising on Harry Tector's right thumb after he was struck by a rip-roaring Jasprit Bumrah bouncer.
It's another early-morning start in New York and the weather looks good for a game of cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Canada and Ireland have a 2-2 head-to-head record in T20Is, but haven't met since 2019.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar has an economy rate of 6.14 against right-hand batters in T20 cricket.
Mark Adair is sixth on the wicket-taker's list in T20Is this year, with 18 in 10 games.
